articles.title: Suit in US challenges H-1B fee hike
articles.excerpt: Subscribe Now! Get features like A coalition of workers unions, non-profit organisations and religious groups launched the first legal challenge against President Donald Trump’s H-1B visa fee hike, arguing the president lacks authority to unilaterally alter the terms of an immigration programme created by Congress. The lawsuit, filed in the United States District Court in the Northern District of California on Friday, seeks to overturn Trump’s presidential proclamation that raised H-1B application fees from roughly $2,000 to $100,000 — a change widely expected to make hiring foreign workers uneconomical for most US companies..

articles.title: Riot police clash with protesters at Georgian palace amid election turmoil
articles.excerpt: Riot police in Tbilisi used water cannons, pepper spray, and tear gas to disperse anti-government protesters outside Georgia’s presidential palace on Saturday, as tensions flared during municipal elections. Thousands of demonstrators, many waving Georgian, European Union, and Ukrainian flags, had gathered earlier in the capital’s Freedom Square and along Rustaveli Avenue, accusing the ruling Georgian Dream (GD) party of authoritarianism and pro-Russian leanings. Some opposition leaders called for a “peaceful revolution” to remove the government.

articles.title: London police arrest hundreds at protest against ban on Palestine action
articles.excerpt: London police arrested dozens of protesters for supporting a banned pro-Palestinian group at a demonstration on Saturday which went ahead despite requests to call it off after a deadly attack at a synagogue in Manchester. Two people were killed in the attack in the northwestern English city on Thursday, and police shot dead the assailant, a British man of Syrian descent who counter-terrorism police said may have been inspired by extremist Islamist ideology. Organisers refused requests by the police and government to call off Saturday's demonstration, which had been announced before the attack, to protest against the banning of the pro-Palestinian group Palestine Action under anti-terrorism laws.STARMER CALLS FOR CALM.

articles.title: Multi-crore Ponzi scam uncovered in Thane, 4 arrested
articles.excerpt: The Economic Offences Wing (EOW) of Thane City Police has uncovered a multi-crore Ponzi and investment fraud that duped thousands of investors, primarily working-class individuals, out of their hard-earned money. The scam, run by Phoenix Investments in Dombivli for the past three to four years, promised high returns and initially paid out investors until early 2024. However, since then, the masterminds and their accomplices allegedly fled the city with crores of rupees, leaving offices and branches shuttered and investors in despair.

articles.excerpt: As Delhi Police continue their probe into the molestation and sexual harassment allegations against self-styled godman Swami Chaitanyanand Saraswati, disturbing details have now emerged about his social media behaviour. Posts from his verified X (formerly Twitter) account reveal a pattern of inappropriate, flirtatious, and suggestive comments on photographs uploaded by women. In one instance, a woman posted a picture captioned, “I’m from Islamabad and you?” to which Chaitanyanand replied, “I am from NYC.” In another, a user wrote in Hindi, “Khana bana rahi hu aap sab ke liye, kaun kaun khaega?” (I’m cooking for everyone, who wants to eat?).

articles.title: Vedanta extends deadline for demerger to March next year | Company Business News
articles.excerpt: New Delhi, Oct 4 (PTI) Anil Agarwal-led Vedanta Ltd has pushed the deadline for its demerger to March-end next year as the approvals from the National Company Law Tribunal and government authorities are still pending, the company has said in a regulatory filing. The deadline was earlier extended from March 31, 2025 to September 30 this year. "Given that the conditions precedent in the Scheme, including approval of the National Company Law Tribunal, Mumbai Bench (NCLT) and approvals from certain government authorities are in the process of being completed, the board of the company and the resulting companies...have decided to extend the timeline for fulfilment of the conditions precedent from September 30, 2025 to March 31, 2026," Vedanta had said in a filing this week..

articles.title: Rajasthan cough syrup deaths: AAP protests outside pharma firm, seeks closure
articles.excerpt: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Saturday held a protest in Jaipur, demanding the closure of city-based Kaysons Pharma, a pharmaceutical firm involved in manufacturing cough syrups that are under the scanner for reportedly causing two child deaths in the state. The AAP agitation came days after the state Medical and Health Department halted the supply of all 19 medicines manufactured by Kaysons Pharma, along with all other syrups containing dextromethorphan, until further orders. On Saturday, AAP workers were seen holding a protest outside Kaysons Pharma amid reports that two children died after allegedly consuming cough syrup manufactured by the firm in Rajasthan’s Sikar district..

articles.title: Hold Bihar election soon after Chhath, in single phase: Parties urge poll body
articles.excerpt: Political parties in Bihar on Saturday urged the Election Commission of India (ECI) to schedule the state Assembly elections immediately after the Chhath festival, which falls on October 28 this year. Parties also recommended that the elections be conducted in the minimum possible phases to ensure smoother voting and counting.ECI MEETING WITH POLITICAL PARTIES The Commission interacted with representatives of recognised national and state parties, including the Aam Aadmi Party, Bahujan Samaj Party, Bharatiya Janata Party, Communist Party of India (Marxist), Indian National Congress, National People's Party, CPI(ML) Liberation, Janata Dal (United), Lok Janshakti Party (Ram Vilas), Rashtriya Janata Dal, and Rashtriya Lok Janshakti Party. During the discussions, parties emphasised holding elections immediately after Chhath and completing the process in as few phases as possible.HOLD ASSEMBLY ELECTIONS IN A SINGLE PHASE: JD(U).

articles.title: PM Modi to inaugurate Rs 19,647 crore Navi Mumbai airport on October 8
articles.excerpt: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate the first phase of the Navi Mumbai International Airport (NMIA) on October 8, a senior Maharashtra government official confirmed on Saturday. The state-of-the-art greenfield airport has been built at a cost of Rs 19,647 crore and will mark the second major airport in the Mumbai Metropolitan Region after the existing Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport. The commercial flight operations from Navi Mumbai Airport are expected to begin in December.

articles.excerpt: The United Kingdom’s Prime Minister, Keir Starmer, will make his first official visit to India on October 8-9, 2025, at the invitation of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, the Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) announced.INDIA-UK STRATEGIC PARTNERSHIP IN FOCUS During the two-day visit, the two leaders are expected to review progress under the India-UK Comprehensive Strategic Partnership through the ‘Vision 2035’ roadmap, a 10-year plan covering trade and investment, technology and innovation, defence and security, climate and energy, health, education, and people-to-people ties. On October 9 in Mumbai, Modi and Starmer will engage with business and industry leaders to explore opportunities presented by the India–UK Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA). The discussions will also cover issues of regional and global importance.

articles.title: 2 killed in suspected methane explosion at UP coaching centre
articles.excerpt: At least two people were killed and seven others injured in an explosion at a coaching centre in Uttar Pradesh's Farrukhabad on Saturday. The blast likely occurred due to excessive concentrated methane in the septic tank located in the coaching centre's basement, police said. Methane is a highly flammable gas and its accumulation in confined spaces such as septic tanks can pose a significant risk if not properly ventilated.

articles.title: Stellantis Said to Plan $10 Billion in US Turnaround Investments
articles.excerpt: A new Jeep Wrangler 4-Door Sahara 4x4 vehicle displayed for sale at a Stellantis NV dealership in Miami, Florida. Stellantis NV is planning to invest about $10 billion in the US as the troubled maker of Jeep sport utility vehicles and Ram pickups refocuses on the market that’s pivotal to its profits, according to people familiar with the situation. The carmaker may announce in the coming weeks about $5 billion in fresh money on top of a similar amount earmarked earlier in the year, said the people, who declined to be identified discussing information that’s not public.

articles.excerpt: In today's DNA, Zee News Managing Editor Ragul Sinha analysed how Donald Trump's Gaza ceasefire plan splits Hamas. Trending Photos US President Donald Trump’s ceasefire proposal for Gaza has triggered dramatic developments inside Hamas, splitting the group into two factions, with political leaders in Qatar favoring the plan and military commanders in Gaza rejecting it. articles.title: India IT Sector To Grow 4-5% Despite Global Challenges: HSBC
articles.excerpt: India’s IT sector may see a growth in the range of 4-5 per cent in the long run, above the trendline of the past three years, according to a report of HSBC Global Investment Research. Analysts assumed less macro volatility in the coming quarters and expected some recovery in growth in FY27, the report from HSBC Global Investment Research said. The IT services sector is expected to remain sluggish in Q2 FY26, as demand continues to be muted amid macroeconomic uncertainties and the deflationary effects of artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Layoff News: Carmaker Renault plans to cut 3,000 jobs through voluntary redundancy offer, says report | Company Business News
articles.excerpt: French carmaker Renault is reportedly planning to lay off 3,000 employees worldwide, primarily in support roles through a voluntary redundancy program — an offer where staff can choose to leave the company in exchange for a financial package, instead of being directly laid off. The final decision on the lay off is expected to be made by the end of the year, reported French newsletter L'Informe. The job cuts are part of an internal cost savings initiative dubbed “Arrow,” under which Renault aims to reduce its workforce in support services such as human resources, finance and marketing by 15 per cent..

articles.title: Pak asks Trump to develop port on Arabian Sea, close to India's Chabahar
articles.excerpt: Pakistan has dangled an offer before US President Donald Trump to build and run a port on the Arabian Sea as it seeks to warm up to America amid a reset in ties, according to a report in the Financial Times. The civilian port will be located in Pasni, a town in Balochistan's Gwadar district, placing it strategically close to the Chabahar port being developed by India in Iran. The report said advisers to Pakistani army chief Field Marshal Asim Munir have approached top US officials with the offer, valued at up to $1.2 billion.DEEP-WATER PORT IN PASNI As per the blueprint, the US would build and operate a terminal at the port to access Pakistan's critical minerals in Pasni.

articles.title: India Adds Nearly 17 Crore Jobs In 6 Years As Govt Doubles Down On Youth-Centric Policies
articles.excerpt: The unemployment rate slumped from 6.0 per cent in 2017–18 to 3.2 per cent in 2023–24. About 1.56 crore women have joined formal workforce in the past seven years. articles.title: Kerala Joins Other States In Banning Coldrif Cough Syrup After Unexplained Child Deaths
articles.excerpt: After reports from Madhya Pradesh and Rajasthan linked the cough syrup Coldrif to the deaths of at least 11 children over the past month, Kerala has become the latest state to suspend the sale and distribution of the medicine. Kerala’s Health Minister Veena George announced on Saturday that the state’s Drugs Control Department had ordered an immediate halt to all sales of the product as a precautionary measure. The action follows an ongoing probe into suspected contamination in a batch of the syrup, produced by Sresan Pharma, a manufacturer based in Tamil Nadu’s Kanchipuram district.

articles.title: 22-Year-Old Merchant Navy Cadet Missing From Ship Off Sri Lankan Coast, Family Seeks Help
articles.excerpt: A 22-year-old merchant navy cadet from Dehradun, Karandeep Singh Rana, has gone missing while on duty aboard an oil tanker sailing off the coast of Sri Lanka, his family said on Saturday. According to his father, Narendra Singh Rana, Karandeep disappeared on September 20 when the vessel was sailing from Iraq to China via Sri Lanka. The family is now appealing to Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami and the central government for urgent intervention in locating him.

articles.title: Road collapsed, hospital submerged as Bihar reels under floods after heavy rain

In Rohtas district’s Dehri area, the situation turned critical after incessant rain caused severe flooding in Jamuhar.

articles.excerpt: A massive uproar broke out in Chhattisgarh’s Raigarh district earlier this week after a young man, who was escorting two dead bodies in an ambulance, died under mysterious circumstances. He first went missing before being found injured. He later died at a local hospital.
articles.content_snippet: A massive uproar broke out in Chhattisgarh’s Raigarh district earlier this week after a young man, who was escorting two dead bodies in an ambulance, died under mysterious circumstances. He first went missing before being found injured. He later died at a local hospital. Outraged over the young man's death, villagers laid siege to the Dharamjaigarh police station on Wednesday, demanding a thorough investigation and action against those responsible. articles.title: Pak blinks as it signs deal with POK protesters, calls it victory of peace
articles.excerpt: The Pakistani government on Saturday wilted under pressure as it signed an agreement with protesters to end the demonstrations in Pakistan Occupied Kashmir (POK) that raged for five days and left 12 people dead and hundreds injured. Even though the Shehbaz Sharif-led government succumbed to pressure, it called the deal "a victory for peace", a face-saving gesture. The territory witnessed one of its biggest protests in recent years, when talks collapsed between officials and leaders of the Jammu Kashmir Joint Awami Action Committee (JKJAAC), a representative body of protesters, on September 29.

articles.title: Ukraine Claims New Strike on Major Russia Oil-Export Refinery | Company Business News
articles.excerpt: (Bloomberg) -- Ukraine said it attacked the Kirishi oil refinery, known as Kinef, in Russia’s Leningrad region overnight, the second time in a month as Kyiv continues pressure on Russian energy facilities. “The Defense Forces of Ukraine delivered a strike at” the refinery leading to explosions and fire, Ukraine’s General Staff said on social media. “Results of the strike are being checked.” Ukraine’s claim could not be independently verified..

articles.title: 2-Wheeler Sales Rise 9 Per Cent In September On GST Cut, Festive Demand
articles.excerpt: The domestic two-wheeler sales rose 6% YoY and 18% month-on-month (MoM), supported by strong performances from Royal Enfield (43% YoY), Suzuki Motorcycle (37% YoY), and TVS Motor (12% YoY). Trending Photos New Delhi: India’s two-wheeler manufacturers registered a 9 per cent year-on-year (YoY) increase in September dispatches, crossing the two-million mark, buoyed by festive season demand following a cut in Goods and Services Tax (GST). The government reduced the tax on motorcycles up to 350 cc to 18 per cent.

articles.title: Pakistan Proposes US-Built Pasni Port: What It Means For India And China
articles.excerpt: Trending Photos In what could mark a significant geopolitical shift in the region, advisers to Pakistan’s Army Chief General Asim Munir have reportedly presented a proposal to US officials for the construction and operation of a new port at Pasni on the Arabian Sea. The plan, if realized, would offer Washington a strategic foothold in a critical maritime corridor, just miles from Iran and China’s Gwadar port. According to a report by the Financial Times, the proposal envisions transforming the small fishing town of Pasni, located roughly 100 miles from Iran and 70 miles from Gwadar, into a hub for processing and exporting Pakistan’s critical minerals, such as copper and antimony.

articles.title: French Carmaker Renault Mulls Cutting 3,000 Jobs In Support Services Amid Sales Pressure: Report
articles.excerpt: Renault Layoffs: French carmaker Renault SA is mulling plans to reduce the workforce by as many as 3,000 employees worldwide in support services such as human resources, finance and marketing, according to French news site l’informe. It will be around 15 per cent of the total workforce of the carmaker. Renault told AFP that it was considering ways to simplify operations, speed up execution and optimise fixed costs.

articles.title: Woman Journalist Assaulted At Kolkata Railway Station, Chases Molesters Before They Flee
articles.excerpt: A 23-year-old woman journalist was assaulted late Thursday night inside the subway of Sodepur railway station after she resisted molestation by a group of youths, police said. The incident took place around 9.40 pm when the woman, a resident of Sodepur, was returning home alone after meeting a friend. According to her statement, six to seven men, allegedly drunk, followed her into the subway, passed obscene remarks and molested her.

articles.title: Concurrent Gainers: 9 small-cap stocks that gained for 5 days in a row - Consistent performers
articles.excerpt: During the last five trading sessions leading up to October 3, the Sensex stayed mostly flat with a mild upward tilt, inching up by just 47 points to close at 81,207. The benchmark index finished in the green on only two of those five sessions (from September 25 to October 3). Despite the broader market's lackluster and somewhat volatile performance, nine small-cap stocks managed to post gains across all five sessions.

articles.title: No court pause on Sambhal mosque demolition, plea says can trigger riots
articles.excerpt: The Allahabad High Court on Saturday refused to stay the demolition of a mosque and an adjacent marriage hall and a hospital allegedly built on government land in Uttar Pradesh's Sambhal. Dismissing the petition, a single judge bench of Justice Dinesh Pathak directed the mosque committee to file an appeal before the trial court against the demolition order. The petition was filed by Masjid Sharif Gausul Wara Rawa Buzurg and its mutawalli (caretaker), Minjar.

articles.title: Children died due to illness, not cough syrups: Rajasthan health minister's claim
articles.excerpt: Rajasthan Health Minister Gajendra Singh Khinvsar on Saturday dismissed reports that recent child deaths in the state were caused by contaminated cough syrup. Speaking at a press conference in Jaipur, he said the children who died were suffering from other illnesses and did not die after consuming government-supplied medicines. "No child has died from cough syrup.

The 51-metre fast patrol vessel (FPV) is the second in the indigenously built Adamya-class series. The ceremony was attended by Dipti Mohil Chawla, IDAS, Additional Secretary, Ministry of Defence, and Additional Director General Donny Michael, PTM, TM, Coast Guard Commander (Eastern Seaboard), along with senior officials from both central and state governments.

articles.title: Perplexity’s $200 Comet Browser Now Free, CEO Aravind Srinivas Takes Dig At Chrome
articles.excerpt: Perplexity AI has made its Comet browser freely available to all users, eliminating the previous $200-per-month (around Rs 17,000) paywall that restricted access to its advanced features. The announcement was made by CEO Aravind Srinivas on X (formerly Twitter) on October 2, where he also took a playful dig at Google Chrome. Resharing a post from one X user, he wrote, “O hey hi @googlechrome." Check the post here: o hey hi @googlechrome https://t.co/rpkg6JCxMJ— Aravind Srinivas (@AravSrinivas) October 2, 2025 Until now, Comet was available exclusively to Pro and Max subscribers, meaning free users were unable to access its AI-powered tools and some of its most advanced features.

articles.title: Is Zerodha Set To End Free Equity Delivery? Nikhil Kamath Flags Revenue Pressure
articles.excerpt: Zerodha co-founder Nithin Kamath in his latest blog has hinted that the online brokerage platform may implement brokerage charges for equity delivery trades from customers, which are currently non-chargeable, to ensure the sustainability of the business. “We would be forced to start charging brokerage for equity delivery trades to make the business tenable," Kamath said in the blog upon the regulator’s evaluation on whether to stop weekly options completely. Zerodha will see another revenue hit if the regulator stops weekly options completely.

articles.title: Iran executes seven over killings of security forces, cleric
articles.excerpt: Iran on Saturday executed seven men convicted of killing security personnel and a cleric several years ago, the judiciary’s news agency Mizan reported. Six of the men were ethnic Arab separatists accused of carrying out armed attacks and bombings in Khorramshahr, in the southwestern province of Khuzestan, that killed four security forces. The seventh, Saman Mohammadi Khiyareh, a Kurd, was convicted over the 2009 assassination of Mamousta Sheikh al-Islam, a pro-government Sunni cleric in the Kurdish city of Sanandaj.

articles.title: Watchdog cleared ex-Tory minister to work for offshoot of firm linked to China surveillance
articles.excerpt: Acoba advised Richard Fuller he could take up post with Investcorp Securities, a subsidiary of private equity firm backing Sense Time A government watchdog advised a former minister that he could work with a subsidiary of a company linked to Chinese surveillance technology, the Guardian can reveal. Richard Fuller, who served as economic secretary to the Treasury in the governments of Boris Johnson and Liz Truss, wrote to the Advisory Committee on Business Appointments (Acoba) before joining Investcorp Securities as an advisory board member in 2023. articles.title: Use Indian work apps: Education ministry to offices
articles.excerpt: Subscribe Now! Get features like Union education ministry’s higher education department on Friday directed all officials to adopt the Zoho Office Suite for official work, a ‘bold’ move aimed at ‘strengthening digital sovereignty under the Swadeshi movement towards Atmanirbhar Bharat’, according to an official document. In an office memorandum, Nishant Upadhyaya, under secretary of higher education said that the directive aligns with the government’s vision of transforming the country from a service economy into a product nation and building a self-reliant ecosystem in technology, hardware, and software. Officials are now required to use Zoho tools — already integrated with the NIC mail system — for creating, editing, and sharing documents, spreadsheets, and presentations, he said..

articles.title: BJP, Shinde Sena and Uddhav Thackeray spar over ‘fake Hindutva’ ahead of Mumbai civic polls
articles.excerpt: Shiv Sena (UBT) chief Uddhav Thackeray’s recent Dussehra rally speech, in which he accused the BJP of promoting “fake Hindutva” and questioned its commitment to Hindu values, has triggered a sharp political exchange ahead of the upcoming Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) elections. Thackeray’s remarks, which targeted the BJP’s “contradictory” stance on Hindu-Muslim issues and its alliance with the Eknath Shinde-led faction, drew quick responses from leaders of the ruling alliance. BJP leader and Maharashtra Cabinet Minister Chandrashekhar Bawankule hit back at Thackeray, criticising him for aligning with the Congress party which, he claimed, “insults Veer Savarkar.” He questioned why Thackeray refrained from criticising the Congress during his Dussehra speech, saying the former chief minister had “abandoned his father’s ideology by sitting in the lap of Congress.”.

articles.title: Russian airstrike hits Kyiv-bound passenger train in Ukraine, casualties feared
articles.excerpt: A Russian airstrike hit a passenger train in Ukraine's northern Sumy region, causing casualties among the passengers, regional governor Oleh Hryhorov said on Saturday. The Russian attack had targeted a railway station and the train heading to Kyiv had been hit, Hryhorov was quoted by news agency Reuters as saying. At the time of writing, there was no figure given for the number of casualties.

articles.title: The rise of digital money poses significant challenges for regulators
articles.excerpt: Bank of England is at crossroads over the use of crytocurrencies and establishing a financial framework for transactions There are those among us who like the idea of swiping and tapping their way through life, armed with a lifetime of digital information as they enter buildings, book online appointments and take train rides to work. Others are not so keen, fearing that big brother databases chock full of personal details will one day control their movements, if that is not happening already. In the case of cryptocurrencies, and even their nicer sounding cousins – stablecoins – the potential for users to be tracked and traced is writ large, with the added prospect of a shift to digital money leading to unemployment-inducing financial crashes even more frequently than in the past.

articles.title: Rajnath Singh talks tough: India will cross any border to protect citizens
articles.excerpt: Defence Minister Rajnath Singh said that the NDA government had shown its readiness to take decisive action and cross borders when the protection of its citizens and integrity were at stake. Singh cited the 2016 surgical strike, 2019 Balakot airstrike and recent Operation Sindoor as examples to buttress his point. Speaking at JITO Connect, organised by Jain International Trade Organisation, Singh underscored that India didn't see religion when it conducted strikes against Pakistan even though the civilians killed in Pahalgam were shot dead after being identified by their religion.

Among the top 100 richest people on the Hurun India Rich List, seven families are from Bengaluru..

articles.title: Not 'Rule Of Bulldozer': CJI Gavai Says India Governed By Rule Of Law, Cites His Own Ruling
articles.excerpt: Chief Justice of India (CJI) BR Gavai said that the foundation of the Indian republic rests firmly on the rule of law and not on the “rule of the bulldozer." Delivering the inaugural Sir Maurice Rault Memorial Lecture 2025 on ‘Rule of Law in the Largest Democracy’ in Mauritius, Justice BR Gavai stressed that India’s legal system cannot permit the executive to assume the roles of “judge, jury and executioner." “The judgment sent a clear message that the Indian legal system is governed by the rule of law, not by the rule of the bulldozer," Justice BR Gavai said, recalling the Supreme Court’s own ruling that decried “bulldozer justice"- a practice that has come to symbolise the demolition of homes of accused persons without due process. The Supreme Court, he reminded, had earlier held that such demolitions bypass legal processes, infringe on the fundamental right to shelter under Article 21 and violate the principle of rule of law. “It was further held that the executive cannot assume the roles of judge, jury, and executioner simultaneously," he noted, quoting from the verdict.

articles.excerpt: The revised rules will encourage the adoption of digital payments, enhance transparency in toll operations, and improve the overall user experience on National Highways. Trending Photos New Delhi: Commuters not having a functional FASTag will now have to pay just 1.25 times the applicable fee at toll plazas on National Highways (NHs), if they pay through online mode using Unified Payment Interface (UPI), from November 15, the Ministry of Road Transport and Highways said in a statement on Saturday. articles.title: Out On Morning Walk, 3 Ghaziabad Women Killed As Speeding Car Rams Into Them | Video
articles.excerpt: A morning walk turned tragic when a speeding car rammed into four pedestrians in Ghaziabad’s Sihani Gate area, killing three women and leaving a man critically injured, police said. The accident took place around 5.45 am on Rakesh Marg along GT Road, when the victims- all residents of New Kotagaon- were out for their daily walk. CCTV footage of the incident shows the three women, dressed in salwar kameez, crossing the road with a man when a white car suddenly ploughed into them before crashing into the divider.

articles.title: Blast At Farrukhabad Coaching Centre Leaves Two Dead, Several Students Injured
articles.excerpt: Two students were killed and at least 10 others injured after a powerful explosion ripped through a coaching centre near Satanpur mandi in Farrukhabad district, police said. The blast took place around 11 am in the Kadri Gate police station area, reducing the building to rubble and injuring those present inside, officials said. The injured have been shifted to nearby hospitals, where doctors confirmed two deaths.

articles.title: Was Zubeen Garg’s Death Tied To Financial Dispute With Manager? Assam CID Probes
articles.excerpt: The shocking and untimely death of legendary Assamese singer Zubeen Garg has taken an unexpected and disturbing turn, with CID Assam probing a possible financial motive behind his death. The probe team is investigating that financial pressure could be one of the reasons that led to Garg’s death under mysterious circumstances. One of the key aspects under probe is the nature of Zubeen’s financial dealings and whether any tensions erupted between him and his manager, Siddharth Sharma, over financial matters.

articles.title: UK PM Keir Starmer To Visit India Next Week; Hold Talks With PM Modi On Trade, Security
articles.excerpt: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer will make his first official visit to India on October 8–9 at the invitation of Prime Minister Narendra Modi, the Ministry of External Affairs said. During the two-day visit, Keir Starmer and PM Modi will review progress under the India–UK Comprehensive Strategic Partnership in line with Vision 2035. Discussions will cover trade, investment, technology, defence, climate, energy, health and education.
